intro: Borreria centranthoides var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
